result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Trevor Montage Oster

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Trevor Montage Oster not in court, in custody, appearance waived.  Attorney Joseph Thomas Domask in court for Trevor Montage Oster.  Prosecuting attorney Alexandria S. Carlson in court for the State of Wisconsin. Scheduling conference held. Defense is requesting a plea and sentencing date. Case is adjourned in Branch 36.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 18, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Trevor Montage Oster appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Joseph Thomas Domask appeared by video for Trevor Montage Oster.  Prosecuting attorney Thomas Hasle in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Judge Crivello, Branch 36.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 36.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 12, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Trevor Montage Oster not in court, in custody.  Attorney Joseph Thomas Domask in court for Trevor Montage Oster.  Attorney Samuel E. Simpson in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for a State v Lee hearing.  However, Attorney Joseph Domask was appointed as counsel on September 15, 2022.  Attorney Domask informs the court that Mr. Oster is being held in Waukesha County Jail.  Parties request a preliminary hearing.  Court scheduled the matter as requested.  Case adjourned to Branch PE, Rm 146 CJF.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed: Attorney Joseph Domask
Received and Filed: Appointment Status Letter, Attorney Reed

Defendant Trevor Montage Oster not in court, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney Abby Rockendorf in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for status. Mr Oster is housed in Waukesha County. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for cause to the trial court for a State V. Lee Hearing.
Hearing scheduled for September 15, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
OSPD Appointment of Counsel Report, filed.

Defendant Trevor Montage Oster not in court, in custody.  Abby Rockendorf in court, appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a preliminary hearing. State witness present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for cause for a Status of counsel in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.
Status conference scheduled for September 8, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Order to Produce.  Signed and Filed.  nk
Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders. No driving without a valid license.

Defendant Trevor Montage Oster in court with attorney Amanda Poznanski.  Defendant Trevor Montage Oster in custody.  Karen Lynch Vespalec appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Trevor Montage Oster appeared by video means with Attorney. Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Crivello, Branch 36. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL. This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 26, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
